instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi

For no apparent reason the backlight stopped working

Where do I start?
Is that something common with those boards

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Do you get image, only missing backlight?
Any voltage at pin 1 of J8300?
Also check resistance to ground there, w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Hi
Yes picture present
Pin 1 53.75v
With screen connected or disconnected is over 173 k Ohm

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message:
Bad LCD assembly, open LED strips.
Backlight voltage present, but too high because no current flows throuh LED strips...

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message:
OK, could be the cable, I will test it
Cheers

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message: Ok, its on the screen side, the connector is liquid damaged. Hmm, looks like a delicate job to swap this connector. Any pointers?

threads.title: 820 - 00138 -A no back light, no liquid damage
threads.message: Maybe Chip Quik alloy helps you te remove it without applying hot air...
